storyInfo: After the battle at Silverrock Bluffs, Siege and the others once again discover the tracks left by the Steam Knight. She reminisces about the person who once discussed the meaning of 'duty' with her and how his golden mane shone when they were having a stroll.

attributes.content: Once we clear these abandoned plates, the Exemplars will be able to reach Londinium's walls.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Ever since we broke through the pass at Silverrock Bluffs, the Nachzehrer forces have been in full retreat. And here we thought the Sarkaz would be waiting to ambush us in the ruins, but...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: There isn't a single one in sight.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: That strange crimson color in the sky has also started to dissipate.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: To be honest, my nerves are still a little shot. The battles in the past few days have been nightmarish.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Too many fought with their lives for this victory, pushing through all the pain and hardship...
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Anyway, this is a victory that belongs to each and every one of us.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Our home is just around the corner.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Let's pick up the pace, and—
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Suddenly, a massive roar fills the air, and the entire building begins to tremble.
A strange, piercing howl comes from deep inside the building, shattering the few remaining intact windows.
Knew it wouldn't be that easy!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: All other teams, fall in!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: What was that howling sound? The sound of steam?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Vina, can it be––
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Notify the other teams and have them evacuate the building immediately. They are to stay on high alert, find cover, and be ready for anti-air operations.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Our team will proceed in a defensive formation while looking out for any potential attacks.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Vina, when you left the Mausoleum of Kings, you all said the Steam Knight had gone mad!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: But he helped us in the battle at Silverrock Bluffs, didn't he? Everyone's talkin' about how Victoria's glory has returned!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Then, what's his deal now...?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Indeed, Siege can still remember the moment she was lifted by that massive armor, as well as the dull roar coming from it.
'Glorious—Victoria!'
She could not tell if the sounds from that armor were identical to the ones she had heard inside the Mausoleum of Kings. After all, the steel armor made all echoes sound similar.
Is it possible that the one inside the armor is...
Siege shakes her head, dispelling those ridiculous thoughts.
That man's courageous decision to face his own fate should not be tainted by any unrealistic fantasies.
Let's go.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: We'll have the answer when we see him.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: He should be here. At least, he was before.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: The walls and the ground are scarred with traces of flames and blades, forming massive gashes that stretch deeper into the building.
It is not the first time she has seen such traces. They were also there along the corridor in front of the gate of the Mausoleum of Kings, where the statues of bygone kings stood...
According to Victorian canticles, what spews forth from the Steam Knights' blades is unyielding valor.
What about now?
There are Sarkaz corpses here.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: By the looks of things, this is where the Sarkaz planned to besiege and kill the last Steam Knight.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Siege recoils in horror. She has heard these words before.
A hand tugs at her sleeve.
...Siege.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Dagda looks at her. The two have experienced the very same thing in the Mausoleum of Kings.
The burial ground of glory.
He is the last Steam Knight.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: If he chooses to stand in our way again like in Londinium...
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: It's alright. I know we'll have to face him sooner or later.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: ...Dagda.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: He has his duty, and we have ours.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.text: Someone once told her that the purpose of her entire life in Londinium was merely to fulfill a duty.

attributes.content: Indeed...
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.text: But she has long decided not to acknowledge that anymore.

attributes.content: We should cast aside all these duties and save him. Simple as that.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Do we... have the right to do that?
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Better to act first and apologize later than to stand here worrying about it.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Let's go.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Siege ruffles the short girl's black hair and steps into the room first.
Charred corpses are everywhere, and these are pieces of the Steam Knight's armor.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: It should have been more of an encounter battle than a proper ambush. By the looks of things, the Sarkaz weren't prepared to face such a tough opponent here.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I've taken a look around. No Sarkaz survivors.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The only place left to search is the space deeper inside.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Behind the broken wall, the other half of the room is shrouded in thick darkness.
Not a single sound or breath can be heard from within as if the sound of steam from earlier was just an illusion.
You all stay here and be ready to evacuate.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Siege slowly approaches the darkness deeper inside the room.
Perhaps, she would be greeted by a torrent of steam and smoke.
Perhaps, her face would soon be illuminated by the light of a blazing longsword.
Siege can't help thinking about the best outcome. Perhaps...
The friend whom she thought she had lost might be leaning next to a massive steam armor, sound asleep.
How are things on your side, Vina?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Nothing here.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: The Steam Knight is already gone. The gushing and crashing sounds earlier we heard were probably the sounds of him breaking through the wall and leaving.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Maybe, he's already back in Londinium.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Let our troops outside know that the alert has been lifted. We'll continue forward in ten minutes.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Sure. I'll make the call.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Everyone feels relieved.
Yet, Siege only sighs.
Vina, you...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Don't worry about it.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Let's keep moving.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: She does not speak a word of what she discovered.
It doesn't prove anything.
Or rather, everything has already been proven.
The Exemplars have arrived at the designated location at the scheduled time. Londinium's walls are now within sight.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Next, we will continue northeast until we reach the outer plate. All vehicles, please confirm your coordinates...
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: The sunset, now no longer tainted by that vile crimson shade, forms a spectacular sight. However, Siege's mind is elsewhere.
The golden afterglow reminds her of her teacher's magnificent mane and the longsword that has been part of countless legends in her hand...
As well as––
Vina, what are you looking at?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Nothing in particular.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Siege clenches her fists in panic, then chuckles self-deprecatingly.
I'm not acting like myself, am I?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: She hesitates for a few seconds before opening her palm.
There, in her hand, is a tattered red cloth with burned edges.

The cloth begins to flutter in the blustery wind. Delphine hurriedly tries to grasp the cloth before the wind carries it away, but Siege loosens her grip, letting it fly away until it disappears into the distance.
What was that?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Something I found in that abandoned plate.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: It might've been just another piece of clothing lying around. It might've been there all along and had nothing to do with the Steam Knight.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: (Red clothing...)
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Do you think Allerdale Cumberland might still be alive?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: There are many people whom I hope are still alive. However, such wishes are meaningless—it's like wishing I were still a street thug back in Norport, and that none of this ever happened.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I heard from members of the Self-Salvation Corps that Allerdale Cumberland was their former leader. She never returned from the mission to retrieve the Sighs of Kings.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: She sacrificed herself for us.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: But that's not the whole story, is it?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: You know what my old job was.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Back in Londinium, the kind of intel I was chiefly responsible for gathering, apart from the movement of the Sarkaz, was about secret agents like me.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The Duke of Cumberland is no more, but his heir still moves freely about in Londinium. We all know what that means.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Vina, I have no intention of influencing your opinion of her, but there is no unconditional kindness and support among the Victorian worthies. I must say that––
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: She approached me with an agenda.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I know. We... had a heart-to-heart talk. She worked for Caster, helping her to seize the Sighs of Kings.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: And despite all that, you still hope to see her alive.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I... am still willing to see her as a friend.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: This is a dangerous decision driven by your emotions, Vina. An army can't maintain itself without discipline.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I know, Delphine. Allerdale and I know this is an irreparable and unforgivable sin.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Still, I regret not being powerful enough to save her... and many others.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I've never had any direct dealings with Lady Cumberland, only seeing her a few times in Londinium from a distance. She put a lot of effort into maintaining a dignified appearance.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I can imagine the price she had to pay for that.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I might come off as insensitive to say this, but I've met many people like Lady Cumberland. That's just the way the game is played in this country.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: She was just another actor on the stage, and her fate was not in her own hands.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I might be able to break free from that... because I met you.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Because of all of you, I have the option to break free from the inertia of depravity and to stop playing a pitiful, supporting role at the worthies' gatherings.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: But Lady Cumberland? She was alone and helpless back then.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Allerdale... I always saw her as one who faced her fate with her head held high. She was not some loser who decided to give in.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Is that its own kind of laziness—to blame each and every tragedy on cruel fate, Delphine?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: It's a form of laziness I've grown accustomed to.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Many things cannot be achieved through sheer hard work, Vina. We use 'fate' to describe these vast and intangible forces because they cannot be defied.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Hah. The 'inertia of depravity,' right?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Those who step out of line will be culled—gently, yet decisively—just like the Steam Knights.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Just like... Alistair, my father.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Vina...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Don't worry, I have no interest in raising a stink in his name. To be honest, I never even knew him that well.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Funnily enough, when I was young, my adoptive parents used to tell me stories about my father, the great 'King Alistair,' all the time...
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: But they passed away too early that I barely remember those stories anymore.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: It wasn't until Allerdale mentioned the King's name to me again that all those fragmented memories started to rush back. Rash, ambitious, determined to accomplish something big...
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Haha, I'm not sure what similarities we share beyond our blood ties. He was a monarch hanged for his failed reforms, offending nearly all the nobles.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: As for me, I'm just a Norport gangster. The only place I'm familiar with, besides the bar and boxing gym, is the police station.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: We share the surname of 'Victoria,' but that's about it.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: The Duke of Windermere's duty has always been to safeguard the border between Victoria and Leithanien. We've never paid much attention to the political struggles taking place in Londinium.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: But... it's true that my mother spoke very little of the coup and King Alistair.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I think she deliberately avoided talking about it. I actually analyzed the situation before—
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: There wasn't anything she could do, and I understand that. Delphine, you don't need to feel sorry for me. That's just how the rules of the game are in Victoria—beneath the calm facade, everything has already been decided.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Regardless of what my mother thought at the time, I don't think the people were at fault for seeking change.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Change is something we all want, isn't it? It's just that... nobody knows how to go about it.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Yes. Everyone back then knew something was wrong, just as they do now.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: This war indeed is reshaping Victoria, but in what direction?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: But... are we truly getting any closer to the future we hope for?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: We've just witnessed Wellington's betrayal, as well as the indecision of the dukes. These are things that've happened time and again.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Delphine, what do you think is the reason behind everything we're facing and what our country is going through?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Do you really want my opinion?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Simply put, it's because we've been deceived by the brutal and cunning Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: All Victoria needs is time. I could easily come to the same conclusion as every noble reading newspaper in their manor.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: But we've seen it firsthand.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Our 'glorious homeland' is short-sighted, arrogant, and reckless. It is filled with greedy nobles, incompetent bureaucrats, a weak parliament, and landowners or factory owners who exploit their workers...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The problem is that Victoria might always has been this way, even during what people consider as her golden age.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: ––All of these things are the sources of Victoria's former glory, yet they are also the inertia that we so despise.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: But then again, we have a team now. It might be time to do more.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: What do you mean?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Ah. It suddenly dawned on me that I might share another similarity with my father.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Both our enemy is 'Victoria.'
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: He might've been too reckless, but I might not be any better than him either. Maybe... I'll even meet the same end as he did.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: But it's still worth a shot, isn't it?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Vina—I mean, Alexandrina Vina Victoria—do you know what you're saying right now?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Indeed, we've found ourselves some companions, and the Exemplars have created a miracle in this battle...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: But this is just Londinium, a single city! How many cities are there across of all Victoria?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The soldiers and officers involved in this war see you as a hero because the dukes—
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The dukes need a hero to cover up their failures. We are just icons they use as a front. I'm well aware of that.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: But, so what?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: We're already here.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Everything that has driven Victoria's 'inertia,' the obsession with glory, the worship of splendor, the monarchy, and the puppet Parliament...
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Must end here.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: You want to change all of that?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: More than just change.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I will wage war against them.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: It certainly won't be an easy task. We might need to fight against everything that makes up this country, including ourselves. It might take a long, long time, up to a decade or even two...
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: But if I want to make sure what happened in Londinium today never happens again, this is the only way.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I need to vanquish the Victoria of the pastuntil I'm the only one left in the ring.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: That's a distant dream. And, rationally speaking, it might never even come true.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: There's no shortage of reformers and even revolutionaries in this country. Some succeeded, while others failed.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Yet, all their efforts invariably ended up lost in the mists of Londinium. And Victoria has never changed.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: But... Vina, you'll treat this as a ring, won't you?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: That's right. Regardless of what I face, there's only one thing I can do—give it a good 'slobberknocker'.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: *sigh*.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Just to be clear, I have no intent on stepping into the ring with you.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: But... if you do manage to land a few good punches, I'll be cheering for you.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Sounds good.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: It's time to let the people of Londinium know that the Exemplars are on their side!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: We... are home.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Siege catches a glimpse of a golden figure flashing from the corner of her eyes.
Her adoptive father once told her in a hopeful tone that her teacher was the very symbol of Victoria.
With him at her side, she would lead the country until all suffering was banished by the light of glory.
What would her teacher be thinking now?
His strides are always so quick, and his appearances are always unpredictable.
His golden mane protects her from the wind and keeps her warm through the coldest nights.
He exudes an aura that resembles the sun.
But... he has not been seen for years.
Vina.
attributes.name: Gawain

attributes.content: The coffin was too big, and my hands felt sore. Even with the help of adults, carrying the coffin into the cemetery was a laborous task.
My adoptive father was buried right next to my adoptive mother. They both shared the same gravestone.
Those visitors who used to frequent my place when I was little didn't show up. They must have given up already. After all, it's been so long.
You've gained knowledge, learned to fight, and equipped yourself with survival skills.
attributes.name: Gawain

attributes.content: There is nothing left for me to teach you.
attributes.name: Gawain

attributes.content: My teacher seemed to let out a gentle sigh. He turned around, his golden mane coming close to my face.
As always, it smelled like sunlight.
But, my child, you do not know where to go.
attributes.name: Gawain

attributes.content: You do not know what to do with the things you've learned from me.
attributes.name: Gawain

attributes.text: 'They always said that the reason I can see you is because I have a duty.'

attributes.content: No, there's no such thing as duty.
attributes.name: Gawain

attributes.content: It applies to both you and me.
attributes.name: Gawain

attributes.content: Only the shackled call their chains their duty.
attributes.name: Gawain

attributes.content: If you're finally ready to step forward...
attributes.name: Gawain

attributes.content: Then, I—
attributes.name: Gawain

attributes.content: One minute, I'm getting a new message—
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Understood. Please continue the investigation, and ask Rhodes Island for help if necessary.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: What happened?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Our technicians have detected a signal that has been listening to our conversations.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Is it the duke? Or the Sarkaz?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Strangely enough, neither.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: According to the signal analysis... the perpetrator's name is one that I've never heard of before...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The people of Londinium seem to call her 'Millscar'.
attributes.name: Delphine
